title: "setup.py clean" deletes configuration files of IDE.
body_html:
Issue description

I'm using Visual Studio Code and Visual Studio. These IDEs store configurations to FOLDER/.vscode and FOLDER/.vs.
When I do "setup.py clean", these folders are deleted because those are described in .gitignore file.
Thus I need to reconfigure IDE settings whenever I executes "setup.py clean".

I think a behaviour of "setup.py clean" may be overkill and might be need to add "clean_ignore_list" (contain .vscode, .vs, and so on) to setup.py.

body:
## Issue description

I'm using Visual Studio Code and Visual Studio. These IDEs store configurations to FOLDER/.vscode and FOLDER/.vs.
When I do "setup.py clean", these folders are deleted because those are described in .gitignore file.
Thus I need to reconfigure IDE settings whenever I executes "setup.py clean".

I think a behaviour of "setup.py clean" may be overkill and might be need to add "clean_ignore_list" (contain .vscode, .vs, and so on) to setup.py.
